column5: Hey all,  Just wondering if any of you have links to sites that speak to historic fishing information and photographs. Interesting subject, but not having much luck finding stuff online...  Thanks!

Not sure if this will interest you,,,  <object style="height: 390px; width: 640px"><param name="movie" value="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Gl3G8gx7sgg?version=3"><param'>http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Gl3G8gx7sgg?version=3"><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"><param name="allowScriptAccess" value="always"><embed src="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Gl3G8gx7sgg?version=3" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" allowfullscreen="true" allowScriptAccess="always" width="640" height="390"></object>  <object style="height: 390px; width: 640px"><param name="movie" value="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KdoUcBu4kbg?version=3"><param'>http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KdoUcBu4kbg?version=3"><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"><param name="allowScriptAccess" value="always"><embed src="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KdoUcBu4kbg?version=3" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" allowfullscreen="true" allowScriptAccess="always" width="640" height="390"></object>

Its no secret that I'm interested in the history and fishing of the Nipigon area. Here are a few links to photos and some things I have found. 1: a fishing trip photo album from 1928 http://members.shaw....easefamily.html 2:a map from the early 1900's of the "Nepigon" river http://members.shaw....magnifymap.html 3: the only video I know of, that shows the "Nepigon" prior to 1923 There is more historic stuff under other drop-down tabs about the famous river. Enjoy....Alan
ahh  awesome stuff!  Thank you all...
